Vulnerability.Title: rasdaemon bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The rasdaemon packages provide a RAS (Reliability, Availability and Serviceability) logging tool, which records memory errors, using the EDAC tracing events. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the return value of the snprintf() function was not used correctly in the bitfield.c:bitfield_msg() function of the rasdaemon utility. Consequently, a buffer overflow occurred when the buffer was too small. This bug has been fixed, and the buffer overflow no longer occurs. (BZ#1035741) This update fixes bugs in the mce-amd-k8.c:bank_name() and ras-mc-handler.c:ras_mc_event_handler() functions of the rasdaemon utility. (BZ#1035742, BZ#1035746) Previously, the rasdaemon unit file did not include the rasdaemon command with the "-r" option that records errors to a database. Consequently, the database was not created, which caused an error when the ras-mc-ctl utility attempted to query it. With this update, the "-r" option has been included in the service file, and the database is now created by default. (BZ#1117366) Prior to this update, the rasdaemon unit file did not include the rasdaemon command with the "--enable" option. Consequently, rasdaemon did not enable the tracepoints used by Hardware Error Reporting Mechanism (HERM) to pass events to user space. With this update, the "--enable" option has been included in the service file, and the tracepoints are now correctly enabled. (BZ#1117367) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: With this update, the rasdaemon package has been modified to build successfully on host machines using the 64-bit ARM CPU architecture. (BZ#1070973) With this update, the rasdaemon package has been modified to build successfully on host machines using the little-endian variant of the IBM Power Systems CPU architecture. (BZ#1125663) With this update, support for processing eMCA errors from perf trace kernel interfaces has been added to the rasdaemon utility. (BZ#1085519) Users of rasdaemon are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fixthese bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
